results.title: Systematic literature review of efficacy/effectiveness and safety of current therapies for the treatment of cryopyrin-associated periodic syndrome, hyperimmunoglobulin D syndrome and tumour necrosis factor receptor-associated periodic syndrome
results.text_hl: Among included studies, four were RCTs (@CHEMICAL_canakinumab @CHEMICAL_MESH:C541220 @@@canakinumab@@@, n=2 (@DISEASE_Cryopyrin_Associated_Periodic_Syndromes @DISEASE_MESH:D056587 @@@CAPS@@@, n=1; @DISEASE_Job_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D007589 @@@HIDS@@@/@<m>DISEASE_Mevalonate_Kinase_Deficiency</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D054078 @@@MKD@@@ and @DISEASE_Periodic_fever_familial_autosomal_dominant @DISEASE_MESH:C536657 @@@TRAPS@@@, n=1); rilonacept, n=1 (in @DISEASE_Cryopyrin_Associated_Periodic_Syndromes @DISEASE_MESH:D056587 @@@CAPS@@@); @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@, n=1 (in @DISEASE_Job_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D007589 @@@HIDS@@@/@<m>DISEASE_Mevalonate_Kinase_Deficiency</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D054078 @@@MKD@@@)).

citations.NLM: Kuemmerle-Deschner JB, Gautam R, George AT, Raza S, Lomax KG, Hur P. Systematic literature review of efficacy/effectiveness and safety of current therapies for the treatment of cryopyrin-associated periodic syndrome, hyperimmunoglobulin D syndrome and tumour necrosis factor receptor-associated periodic syndrome RMD Open. 2020 Jul;6(2):. PMID: 32723831
citations.BibTeX: @article{32723831, title={Systematic literature review of efficacy/effectiveness and safety of current therapies for the treatment of cryopyrin-associated periodic syndrome, hyperimmunoglobulin D syndrome and tumour necrosis factor receptor-associated periodic syndrome}, author={Kuemmerle-Deschner JB and Gautam R and George AT and Raza S and Lomax KG and Hur P}, journal={RMD Open}, volume={6}, number={2}}

results.title: Mevalonate kinase deficiencies: from mevalonic aciduria to hyperimmunoglobulinemia D syndrome
results.text_hl: There is no established successful treatment for @<m>DISEASE_Mevalonate_Kinase_Deficiency</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D054078 @@@MVA@@@. @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@, an inhibitor of @GENE_HMGCR @GENE_3156 @@@HMG-CoA reductase@@@, and anakinra have been shown to have beneficial effect in @<m>DISEASE_Mevalonate_Kinase_Deficiency</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D054078 @@@HIDS@@@.

citations.NLM: Haas D, Hoffmann GF. Mevalonate kinase deficiencies: from mevalonic aciduria to hyperimmunoglobulinemia D syndrome Orphanet J Rare Dis. 2006 Apr 26;1():13. PMID: 16722536
citations.BibTeX: @article{16722536, title={Mevalonate kinase deficiencies: from mevalonic aciduria to hyperimmunoglobulinemia D syndrome}, author={Haas D and Hoffmann GF}, journal={Orphanet J Rare Dis}, volume={1}, pages={13}}

results.title: A patient with hyper-IgD syndrome responding to simvastatin treatment.
results.text_hl: A @SPECIES_9606 @@@patient@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Mevalonate_Kinase_Deficiency</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D054078 @@@hyper-IgD syndrome@@@ responding to @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ treatment.

citations.NLM: Attout H, Guez S, Ranaivo I, Jameerbaccus N, Series C. A patient with hyper-IgD syndrome responding to simvastatin treatment. Eur J Intern Med. 2008 Dec;19(8):e82-3. PMID: 19046710

results.title: Anti-inflammatory and cytoprotective effects of a squalene synthase inhibitor, TAK-475 active metabolite-I, in immune cells simulating mevalonate kinase deficiency (MKD)-like condition
results.text_hl: @CELLLINE_CVCL:0006 @@@THP-1@@@ cells were pretreated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ (4 mumol/L) for 24 h in order to induce @<m>DISEASE_Mevalonate_Kinase_Deficiency</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D054078 @@@MKD@@@-like phenotype by reducing endogenous @GENE_MAFD2 @GENE_4096 @@@MDI@@@ levels (Galeotti et al.).

citations.NLM: Suzuki N, Ito T, Matsui H, Takizawa M. Anti-inflammatory and cytoprotective effects of a squalene synthase inhibitor, TAK-475 active metabolite-I, in immune cells simulating mevalonate kinase deficiency (MKD)-like condition Springerplus. 2016;5(1):1429. PMID: 27652005
citations.BibTeX: @article{27652005, title={Anti-inflammatory and cytoprotective effects of a squalene synthase inhibitor, TAK-475 active metabolite-I, in immune cells simulating mevalonate kinase deficiency (MKD)-like condition}, author={Suzuki N and Ito T and Matsui H and Takizawa M}, journal={Springerplus}, volume={5}, number={1}, pages={1429}}

results.title: Simvastatin treatment for inflammatory attacks of the hyperimmunoglobulinemia D and periodic fever syndrome.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ treatment for @DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammatory attacks@@@ of the @<m>DISEASE_Mevalonate_Kinase_Deficiency</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D054078 @@@hyperimmunoglobulinemia D@@@ and @DISEASE_Hereditary_Autoinflammatory_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D056660 @@@periodic fever syndrome@@@.

citations.NLM: Simon A, Drewe E, van der Meer JW, Powell RJ, Kelley RI, Stalenhoef AF, Drenth JP. Simvastatin treatment for inflammatory attacks of the hyperimmunoglobulinemia D and periodic fever syndrome. Clin Pharmacol Ther. 2004 May;75(5):476-83. PMID: 15116060

results.title: Hyperimmunoglobulinemia D and periodic fever syndrome; treatment with etanercept and follow-up.
results.text_hl: There is no consensus for specific therapy of @<m>DISEASE_Mevalonate_Kinase_Deficiency</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D054078 @@@HIDS@@@, but there are some case reports and studies in regards to its treatment with drugs like @CHEMICAL_Colchicine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D003078 @@@colchicine@@@, @CHEMICAL_Steroids @CHEMICAL_MESH:D013256 @@@steroids@@@, nonsteroid anti-inflammatory drugs, @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@, anakinra, @CHEMICAL_Thalidomide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D013792 @@@thalidomide@@@, and etanercept.

citations.NLM: Topaloğlu R, Ayaz NA, Waterham HR, Yüce A, Gumruk F, Sanal O. Hyperimmunoglobulinemia D and periodic fever syndrome; treatment with etanercept and follow-up. Clin Rheumatol. 2008 Oct;27(10):1317-20. PMID: 18506569
citations.BibTeX: @article{18506569, title={Hyperimmunoglobulinemia D and periodic fever syndrome; treatment with etanercept and follow-up.}, author={Topaloğlu R and Ayaz NA and Waterham HR and Yüce A and Gumruk F and Sanal O}, journal={Clin Rheumatol}, volume={27}, number={10}, pages={1317-20}}

results.text_hl: @<m>DISEASE_Mevalonate_Kinase_Deficiency</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D054078 @@@Hyper-IgD syndrome@@@ with novel mutation in a Japanese girl.

results.title: Compromized geranylgeranylation of RhoA and Rac1 in mevalonate kinase deficiency
results.text_hl: In contrast, treatment of six @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with a milder @<m>DISEASE_Mevalonate_Kinase_Deficiency</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D054078 @@@MKD@@@:i.e. hyper-@<m>DISEASE_Mevalonate_Kinase_Deficiency</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D054078 @@@IgD syndrome@@@:with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ (Simon et al) did not provoke clinical crises.

citations.NLM: Henneman L, Schneiders MS, Turkenburg M, Waterham HR. Compromized geranylgeranylation of RhoA and Rac1 in mevalonate kinase deficiency J Inherit Metab Dis. 2010 Oct;33(5):625-32. PMID: 20814828

results.title: HMG-CoA reductase inhibition induces IL-1beta release through Rac1/PI3K/PKB-dependent caspase-1 activation.
results.text_hl: Here we show that inhibition of @GENE_HMGCR @GENE_3156 @@@HMG-CoA reductase@@@ by @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ treatment, mimicking @<m>DISEASE_Mevalonate_Kinase_Deficiency</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D054078 @@@MKD@@@, results in increased @GENE_IL1B @GENE_3553 @@@IL-1beta@@@ secretion in a @GENE_RAC1 @GENE_5879 @@@Rac1@@@/PI3K-dependent manner.

citations.NLM: Kuijk LM, Beekman JM, Koster J, Waterham HR, Frenkel J, Coffer PJ. HMG-CoA reductase inhibition induces IL-1beta release through Rac1/PI3K/PKB-dependent caspase-1 activation. Blood. 2008 Nov 1;112(9):3563-73. PMID: 18684863
citations.BibTeX: @article{18684863, title={HMG-CoA reductase inhibition induces IL-1beta release through Rac1/PI3K/PKB-dependent caspase-1 activation.}, author={Kuijk LM and Beekman JM and Koster J and Waterham HR and Frenkel J and Coffer PJ}, journal={Blood}, volume={112}, number={9}, pages={3563-73}}

results.title: Effect of etanercept and anakinra on inflammatory attacks in the hyper-IgD syndrome: introducing a vaccination provocation model.
results.text_hl: Treatment of @<m>DISEASE_Mevalonate_Kinase_Deficiency</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D054078 @@@HIDS@@@ is difficult, although @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ is beneficial and etanercept might be effective.

citations.NLM: Bodar EJ, van der Hilst JC, Drenth JP, van der Meer JW, Simon A. Effect of etanercept and anakinra on inflammatory attacks in the hyper-IgD syndrome: introducing a vaccination provocation model. Neth J Med. 2005 Jul-Aug;63(7):260-4. PMID: 16093577
